msItem.author: Jerome
msItem.title: Commentary on Isaiah
msItem.rubric: In Christi nomine incipit explanatio sancti Hieronymi in Esaiam prophetam. Incipit prologus
msItem.incipit: Expletis longo uix tempore in xii prophetas
msItem.explicit: (fol. 2r) modum breuitatis excedunt, sed iam propositum prosequamur.
msItem.incipit: (fol. 2r) Uisio Esaie filii Amos quam uidit super Iudam Pro Iuda in quo significantur duae tribus
msItem.explicit: ipse ad oculos pertinet et stridorem
msItem.note: Ending imperfect due to loss of a leaf at the end. Bk. 2, fol. 14r; bk. 3, fol. 28v; bk. 4, fol. 43v; bk. 5, fol. 54r-v; bk. 6, fol. 75v; bk. 7, fol. 90r; bk. 8, fol. 107r-v; bk. 9, fol. 119r; bk. 10, fol. 137r; bk. 11, fol. 148v, bk. 12, 162r; bk. 13, fol. 175r; bk. 14, fol. 189v; bk. 15, fol. 205v; bk. 16, fol. 219r; bk. 17, fol. 235r; bk. 18, fol. 252r-v. Text at the head of fol. 122r (a new quire) struck through to continue from fol. 121v.
msItem.bibl: Commentaires de Jérôme sur le prophète Isaïe, ed. R. Gryson (1993-1999), siglum Ox.

supportDesc.collation: 1-7(8) (fols. 1-56), 8(6-1, 3 cancelled before fol. 59) (fols. 57-61), 9-10(8), 11(6) (fols. 62-83), 12(8) (fols. 84-91), 13(8-1, 8 last leaf cancelled) (fols. 92-8), 14(probably 4+2 with fol. 99 added at the beginning of the quire and fol. 104 added at the end) (fols. 99-104), 15(8) (fols. 105-112), 16(8+1, leaf added (fol. 120) between 7 and 8 (?)) (fols. 113-121), 17(8-1, 1 canc. before fol. 122) (fols. 122-8), 18-21(8) (fols. 129-160), 22(10) (fols. 161-9), 23(6+2: fols. 171-2, a bifolium, are later supply leaves) (fols. 171-8), 24-28(8) (fols. 179-218), 29(6) (fols. 219-224), 30-34(8) (fols. 225-264), 35(8-1, last leaf lost with loss of text). Later paper guards between fols. 61/62, 83/4, 128/9, 152/3, 178/9, 194/5, 218/9, 248/9. Quires numbered in roman on the final verso, bottom centre; earlier numbering erased in places (see Kautz).
supportDesc.condition: Outer margin of fols. 76, 160 excised, with damage to fols. 74, 75, 159; lower margin of fol. 78 excised.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled in drypoint for 1 col., 37 lines; ruled space c. 250 180

handDesc.handNote: Caroline minuscule by several hands; fols. 17r-40v by a scribe influenced by St Vaast script who also wrote MS. Laud Misc. 133 fols. 1-89 and Vatican, BAV, Pal. lat. 211 (Kautz; Bischoff, 1989, p. 42).
Rubrics on fols. 1r and 162r and 205v in square capitals.
Rubrics on fols. 75v and 119r and 175r in rustic capitals.
Other rubrics and sometimes the first line of each book in uncial.

decoDesc.decoNote: Plain initials in the ink of the text, occasionally (e.g fols. 43v, 75r) with modest decoration.
Marginal sketches, 11th century (?), fols. 84r (animal), 121v (partial human figure) (Pächt and Alexander i. 20, pl. III)

additions.p: Extensive contemporary corrections and (in places) alterations to punctuation.
Extensive contemporary and later nota marks.

history.origin:
9th century, second quarter or middle
German, Lorsch, Benedictine abbey (Bischoff 2004)
history.provenance: Lorsch abbey: identifiable in the ninth-century catalogues: A. Häse, Mittelalterliche Bücherverzeichnisse aus Kloster Lorsch. Einleitung, Edition und Kommentar (2002), no. 163 (p. 245)

Cisterican abbey of Eberbach: probably identifiable as F14 in the 1502 catalogue, 'Iheronimus super ysaiam Initium In christi nomine Incipit etc.' (N. Palmer, Zisterzienser und ihre Bücher (1998), pp. 237, 295); probably also in the 'Rheinischen Gesamtkatalog' of the 1470s (ibid., p. 229). Probably removed from Lorsch to Eberbach between 1233 and 1245 while Lorsch was administered by monks from Eberbach (ibid., p. 18)
history.acquisition: Part of his third donation to the Bodleian, 1639. Former shelfmark H. 66 (fol. 1r)

recordHist.source: Description by Matthew Holford (Dec. 2021). Previously described in the Quarto Catalogue (H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885). Quarto Catalogue, cols. 327–8 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 57

Bernhard Bischoff, Die Abtei Lorsch im Spiegel ihrer Handschriften, 2nd ed. (1989), 52, 112-3
